programme.title: World's Deadliest: Animals
programme.desc: From the parched deserts of Southwestern USA to lush forests of the Costa Rican mountains, this episode covers some of the most diverse ecosystems on the planet. The creatures here have adapted to survive in an extraordinary variety of habitats, and that means a diverse array of weapons. .

programme.title: World's Deadliest: Animals
programme.desc: Asia is the largest and most populated continent on the planet. Here people compete for space with some of the most impressive animals in the world. Creatures that have ingenious adaptations to hunt and defend.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin journeys down Australia‚Äôs rivers to find which riparian animal is most built to survive. His first encounter is with the duck-billed platypus, a peculiar and adorable monotreme, or egg-laying mammal. Phil then gets a grip on the ultra-slimy long-finned eel and learns of its extraordinary reproductive habits before finally catching a river-dwelling bull shark.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin wanders into Australia‚Äôs woodlands to find the species most adapted for survival. Phil first encounters the yellow-bellied glider, an intrepid marsupial with a built-in wingsuit. Next is one of Australia‚Äôs most abundant but deadly reptiles, the eastern brown snake. Last but certainly not least, Phil finds the iconic, cuddly and oh-so-sleepy koala.

programme.title: World's Deadliest: Animals
programme.desc: Africas wild spaces host an incredible array of creatures‚Ä¶creatures who engage in a daily ballet of life and death. Now, witness their magnificence by journeying into their inner sanctums.

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm
programme.desc: This family farm needs a barn! The Pols are ready to tackle their next big project: preserving and carefully taking down a 100-year-old barn since, with every piece they remove makes the barn weaker and weaker. There is no room for error if they are going to transport these irreplaceable beams back to the farm and restore it to its former glory. .

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm
programme.desc: The Pols have reached the most dangerous stage of disassembling the 100-year-old barn: taking down the beams. Then, if all goes well, theyll transport the beams back to the farm. Each part of this process must be carefully orchestrated to protect these irreplaceable beams. Meanwhile, Beth tries training Clovis after he runs away from the farm. .

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: With the arrival of spring, animals from all over the South Atlantic are suddenly converging on the Falklands. The striated cara-cara is one of the few year-round inhabitants of the islands.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: Each year, monarch butterflies undertake a multi-generational migration from Mexico all the way to Canada and back again. .

programme.title: Snakes In The City

programme.title: Snakes In The City

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
